crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects an office document with an embedded VBA project. While this is fairly common it is sometimes used for malicious intent.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects malicious document used by MuddyWater
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation
Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe" "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" ; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -w 1 -exec Bypass -nologo -noprofile -c iex(get-content "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.ini");; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: File With Uncommon Extension Created By An Office Application
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of files with an executable or script extension by an Office application.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, FPT.EagleEye Team, Vadim Khrykov, Cyb3rEng, Michael Haag, Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, @scythe_io

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft \xae Windows Script Host; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=wscript.exe; Hashes=SHA1=B441504FB57EB88333856B8F9CDB63FC1C251CF8,MD5=CD3C1773CEF2611325FA884926090538,SHA256=7478B567C9EC9A1E1061F9C6DB2993FCDC2EC4E8FB5CA6DA80FA307B54116E69,IMPHASH=ACD7356FA52D4E2866A873BF9AB94256; Description=Microsoft \xae Windows Based Script Host; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Root\Office16\WINWORD.EXE" /Automation -Embedding; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe" "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" ; FileVersion=5.812.10240.16384; ParentImage=C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\root\Office16\WINWORD.EXE; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Office Application Initiated Network Connection To Non-Local IP
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects an office application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  that initiate a network connection to a non-private IP addresses.
This rule aims to detect traffic similar to one seen exploited in CVE-2021-42292.
This rule will require an initial baseline and tuning that is specific to your organization.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Christopher Peacock '@securepeacock', SCYTHE '@scythe_io', Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

document_summary_info.company: Kiyi Emniyeti Gemi Kurtarma Isletmesi Müdürlügü

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The macro code performs the following actions upon opening the document:

1.  Directory Creation: It attempts to create a directory using the `eHRXG` function in the user's profile. The path is constructed using string concatenation, resulting in a long file path.
2.  File Creation: It dynamically creates a `FileSystemObject` and a text file using a string, `tenYz`, which is assembled by concatenating decoded characters. The `QZkeu` function decrypts a base64 encoded string and writes it to the created file. The path of the file being created is constructed with concatenated strings, and includes multiple directory traversals.
3. File Opening: It attempts to open a file in the user's profile using the `CJmYt` function. Again, the path of the file is constructed by concatenating several decoded characters.
4.  Base64 Decoding and Execution: The `DYTEc` function contains a large, base64 encoded string. The macro decodes this string and executes the resulting code. The decoded string contains Powershell code. The VBA code then calls another function "CJmYt" which attempts to open a file.
5.  Obfuscation: The code uses XOR encryption and function calls to obscure the actual commands and object names. String concatenation via `lFPib` further adds to the obfuscation.
6. Decoy comments are used to mislead analysis of the code.
